glsa.title: phpMyAdmin: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple errors in phpMyAdmin might allow the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Cross-Site Scripting attack.

background.p: phpMyAdmin is a web-based management tool for MySQL databases.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in phpMyAdmin:

ul.li: Greg Ose discovered that the setup script does not sanitize input properly, leading to the injection of arbitrary PHP code into the configuration file (CVE-2009-1151).
Manuel Lopez Gallego and Santiago Rodriguez Collazo reported that data from cookies used in the "Export" page is not properly sanitized (CVE-2009-1150).

impact.p: A remote unauthorized attacker could exploit the first vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running phpMyAdmin and conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks using the second vulnerability.

workaround.p: Removing the "scripts/setup.php" file protects you from CVE-2009-1151.
